basics.name: Abraham Yang 杨杨
basics.label: Senior Frontend Engineer / Frontend Lead
basics.summary: Senior Frontend Engineer with 7+ years in React and Mini Program ecosystems. Drives AI-first engineering to accelerate execution and architectural clarity. Experienced in canvas-based 2D systems and Three.js-driven 3D model customization. Collaborates across APAC markets and leads a cross-platform engineering team.

work.name: Trajectry (formerly EY Fabernovel China)
work.summary: Frontend engineer at a boutique digital consultancy serving global luxury and premium brands.
highlights: Architected and delivered production-grade WeChat and WeCom Mini Program platforms with complex workflow and account systems.
Designed and integrated AI-driven customer support and multilingual translation services into production systems.
Built scalable Mini Program solutions using Taro, React, and TypeScript for global luxury brands including Christie's, Hermès, Messika, and Bucherer.
Coordinated cross-market delivery across APAC regions while maintaining stable production operations.

work.name: Shanghai RJY Information Technology Co., Ltd
work.summary: Led frontend architecture and delivery for DIY clothing application and WeChat Miniprogram, managed agile teams and built CI/CD infrastructure.
highlights: Designed and implemented a customizable clothing platform with real-time 2D/3D rendering using React, Fabric.js, and Three.js.
Architected layer-based editing system (undo/redo, asset pipeline, rendering abstraction) for interactive design workflow.
Built server-side rendering pipeline with Node.js to export high-resolution design assets.
Established CI/CD pipeline and managed production deployment on Alibaba Cloud.

work.name: Shanghai Fumasoft Co., Ltd
work.summary: Core frontend contributor for SaaS and hybrid applications.
highlights: Migrated React Native application to hybrid architecture, improving integration flexibility with native modules.
Designed and implemented JS bridge for bidirectional communication between WebView and native layers.
Improved application stability and reduced hybrid interaction issues through structured routing and lifecycle management.
Led a cross-functional team of 5 engineers (FE, iOS, Android) coordinating sprint planning and technical decisions.

work.name: Publicis Sapient
work.summary: Delivered enterprise-grade marketing and brand platforms for global clients.
highlights: Developed responsive campaign websites and minisites for Huawei, Marriott, and automotive brands.
Implemented interactive mobile experiences using modern JS frameworks and canvas-based rendering.
Collaborated across Singapore, Japan, and India teams in distributed delivery model.
Mentored interns and contributed to frontend standards and reusable component design.

projects.name: Christie's WeChat Miniprogram
projects.description: Ongoing retainer frontend development for Christie's China WeChat Miniprogram, delivering new features and platform enhancements across release cycles.
highlights: Developed private sale module enabling invitation-only lot browsing, bidding access control, and exclusive sale workflows.
Implemented multi-account management system supporting switching between buyer and specialist account contexts within a single session.
Maintained and iterated on production miniprogram features under a continuous retainer delivery model.

projects.name: Luxury Brand Miniprograms
projects.description: Delivered WeChat Miniprogram projects for multiple international luxury brands, covering product showcase, retail, and after-sales service experiences.
highlights: Built Messika and Kallista jewelry brand miniprograms featuring product catalog, collection browsing, and boutique locator.
Developed Bucherer miniprogram supporting watch collection display and service appointment booking.
Implemented Hermès after-sales service miniprogram, enabling customers to submit repair requests and track service status.

projects.name: Monotype Asia Platform
projects.description: Developed and localized the Monotype Asia web platform for CN, TW, and KR markets, supporting font discovery and licensing for regional users.
highlights: Implemented multi-locale architecture supporting Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, and Korean content variants from a shared codebase.
Handled region-specific configuration, routing, and asset management to ensure consistent UX across three markets.

projects.name: Tootools Miniprogram
projects.description: Full-featured WeChat Miniprogram for custom clothing design with real-time 2D editing and 3D preview, serving as the core product of the company.
highlights: Architected a dual-rendering design editor supporting layer management, pattern/font/drawing tools, and undo/redo history using Fabric.js on a React-based canvas.
Implemented real-time 3D preview by projecting user designs onto glTF clothing models via Three.js Decal Geometry.
Built server-side rendering pipeline with Node.js to export high-resolution print-ready design assets.
Developed the Uniapp Miniprogram shell with custom routing and lifecycle management for seamless cross-platform delivery.

projects.name: Fumamx Hybrid App
projects.description: Rebuilt a React Native SaaS application into a hybrid architecture to improve native integration flexibility and accelerate cross-platform delivery.
highlights: Designed and implemented a bidirectional JS bridge using postMessage, enabling structured communication between WebView and native iOS/Android layers.
Introduced Vue Router-based navigation management within the WebView layer, decoupling routing from native navigation stacks.
Improved release velocity by enabling independent web-layer deployments without full native app releases.
Coordinated a cross-functional team of 5 (FE, iOS, Android) through sprint planning and technical alignment.

projects.name: Internal CMS Website
projects.description: Developed an internal CMS website with automated template generation to streamline content publishing workflows.
highlights: Integrated gulp-velocity plugin to auto-generate Velocity template files, reducing manual templating effort.
Delivered a maintainable frontend codebase with modular component structure and build automation via Gulp.

projects.name: DS Automobile Official Website
projects.description: Developed the official marketing website for DS Automobile China, featuring animated experiences and an interactive dealer locator.
highlights: Built a high-fidelity animated landing page with scroll-driven and entrance animations using CSS and JavaScript.
Integrated Baidu Map SDK with custom markers, cluster rendering, and fuzzy search for a nationwide dealer locator.
Produced motion graphics for WeChat official article campaigns, enhancing in-app engagement.

projects.name: IQOS EDM Email Templates
projects.description: Delivered a series of responsive EDM email templates for IQOS marketing campaigns, coordinated across international teams.
highlights: Built responsive, cross-client email templates using MJML, validated across 15+ email clients via Litmus.
Automated email compilation and asset inlining with a Gulp-based build pipeline.
Coordinated deliverables across 3 time zones with distributed stakeholders.

projects.name: Huawei Campaign Minisites
projects.description: Developed multiple interactive marketing minisites for Huawei campaigns, focusing on mobile-first experiences and map integration.
highlights: Built canvas-based interactive mobile experience with gesture controls and frame animation for campaign engagement.
Integrated Tencent Map JSSDK with custom store locator, supporting marker clustering and real-time search.
Extended Swiper.js with custom card collapse and 3D flip transitions to match design specifications.
Integrated WeChat JSSDK for social sharing and in-app browser optimization.

projects.name: Marriott Website CN Localization
projects.description: Adapted Marriott's global website for the Chinese market, replacing unsupported third-party services and ensuring feature parity.
highlights: Re-implemented Google Maps-based hotel locator with Baidu Map SDK, preserving search, filtering, and marker functionality for CN users.
Resolved cross-region API and geo-service incompatibilities introduced by China's web restrictions.
Collaborated with the India-based development team in a distributed delivery model with regular cross-timezone syncs.
